climbs.name: Wall of Mirrors
climbs.fa: S. Willet, P. Moore, M.Nakata, D. Heinrich, D. Bedford, 1998

content.description:
While its hard to imagine five guys getting an equal first ascent on a line this short, its even harder to imagine reading the line they climbed.

Start up a steepening, jutting corner using small crimps and medium sized edges.

Follow the arete for three bolts then break left onto the face after the fourth. Hold on and Believe!!
content.protection: Five bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location: This route starts off a large rock on the right side of the steep face.

content.description: Great route, really fun moves from start to finish, just way too short. Crux would probably be pulling over the bulge halfway up, but really no harder than any other part of the route.
content.location: Farthest right bolted line on wall

content.description: Fun climb, well protected. Crux is in between 3rd and 4th bolt, directional hold and not the best feet.
content.location: Middle bolted line on right side of Wall of Mirrors.

content.description: A nice, bouldery line with a difficult and committing start. This route is strenuous from beginning to end. Short and stout climbing on the bullet proof arete. A spotter might be nice for the initial moves as the first bolt is quite high, a finger-sized cam will set the mind at ease.
content.protection: Two bolts and a finger sized camalot. Bolted anchor.
content.location:
Left most line on the

Wall of Mirrors Right.
